Commentary: pitched up and slanting away outside off, Tamim presses forward, meets the pitch and push-drives through the vacant cover-point region

Commentary: Lakmal finds late inswing and hits the front pad of Tamim. But it pitched outside the leg stump, and it was perhaps bouncing over the stumps too. The opener was struck above the knee-roll

Commentary: back of a length on off, solidly blocked on the front foot

Commentary: full and nipping away just a shade outside off, Tamim pushes away from the body and watches the ball skip past the outside edge

Commentary: full and angling away wider outside off, Tamim shoulders arms
Commentary_short: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

Commentary: overpitched and outside off, Tamim stretches out but does not middle a drive. Instead, he squeezes the ball through extra cover
Commentary_short: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, 2 runs

Commentary: short, wide, the extra pace works in the batsman favour. Anamul slashes it with all his might but straight to backward point
Commentary_short: Chameera to Anamul Haque, no run

Commentary: good-length outswinger, starts outside off and nibbles away further. Anamul watches it through to Dickwella

Commentary: off-stump yorker, which is dug out to the covers
Commentary_short: Chameera to Anamul Haque, no run

Commentary: back of a length and straying into the hips, does not make contact with a flick but secures a leg bye to square leg

Commentary: back of a length, rears up and moves past the outside edge near the higher part of the bat

Commentary: full on off, presses forward but does not meet the pitch, winds up squirting an inside edge to the midwicket region
Commentary_short: Chameera to Tamim Iqbal, no run

Commentary: good length and angling into a forward-defensive to mid-on
Commentary_short: Lakmal to Anamul Haque, no run

Commentary: Loose, loose shot. Full and wide outside off - possibly on a sixth-stump line - Anamul simply throws his hands at the ball. He has a big swish at it and only manages to drag a thick inside edge back onto the stumps. The leg stump is tilted back. Anamul has a long stare at the bowler, he can't believe what he has done. He has bagged a six-ball duck. The search for a solid opening partner for Tamim continues
Commentary_short: Lakmal to Anamul Haque, OUT

Commentary: good length and angling away outside off, Shakib takes it on the up and drives it gloriously between the covers and mid-off. Chandimal chases the ball but dives gingerly and early, letting the ball roll away to the boundary
Commentary_short: Lakmal to Shakib Al Hasan, FOUR runs

Commentary: Lakmal pulls his length back and gets it to slant into off stump, played back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Lakmal to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

Commentary: another glorious drive from Shakib. Whoa! Pitched up just a shade outside off, caressed in the gap between covers and mid-off again
Commentary_short: Lakmal to Shakib Al Hasan, FOUR runs

Commentary: good length and outside off, punched on the up to backward point
Commentary_short: Lakmal to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

Commentary: short of a good length and angling away wide outside off, left alone, off-side wide

Commentary: pitched up on off stump, forward and driven straight to mid-off
Commentary_short: Chameera to Tamim Iqbal, no run

Commentary: full and angling across off, Tamim plays away from the body, carving a drive to square-ish third man
Commentary_short: Chameera to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

Commentary: bouncer on the leg stump, the speed gun says 130ks, but I bet that's a lot quicker. Shakib ducks and the ball soars to Dickwella
Commentary_short: Chameera to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

Commentary: back of a length and outside off, nearly 140ks, but stops the batsman, Shakib spoons a drive in front of mid-off
Commentary_short: Chameera to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

Commentary: back of a length on off, Chameera hits the bat hard and draws a push to mid-off

Commentary: 136.2ks bouncer on middle, Shakib has his eyes locked on the ball before sinking under it

Commentary: pitched up on off stump, pushed to mid-off off the front foot
Commentary_short: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

Commentary: shortish and outside off, punched on the up to cover
Commentary_short: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

Commentary: Danushka, you beauty! He throws the stumps down from backward point at the striker's end but catch Shakib short. Huuuuuge wicket for Sri Lanka. This was even shorter and outside off, punched into the cover-point region. Danushka tears across to his left, swoops down on the ball and nails the stumps.Tamim called for the single, there was a brief hesitation between the wickets, and Shakib gave up in the end. Danushka is one of the best fielders in the SL side. Can't take him on
Commentary_short: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, OUT
Dismissal_text: Shakib Al Hasan run out (Gunathilaka) 8 (8b 2x4 0x6) SR: 100.00

Commentary: full and outside off, tapped into the covers
Commentary_short: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

Commentary: Another stunning piece of fielding from Danushka. His brilliance in the field has sent back both Shakib and Tamim. He throws himself to his right from backward point now, stretches out with both hands, and snaffles a catch. Credit to Lakmal too for banging it short just a shade outside off, surprising the batsman and forcing him to splice a catch. It actually reared up from a back of a length
Commentary_short: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, OUT
Dismissal_text: Tamim Iqbal c Gunathilaka b Lakmal 5 (14b 0x4 0x6) SR: 35.71

Commentary: Lakmal has bounced out Mahmudullah! There was only one man at the boundary on the leg side and the batsman has picked out Chameera at fine leg. This was a plan: dig it short and attack the body with assistance from leg-gully and fine leg. This chest-hunting ball rushes Mahmudullah into the hook and he holes out. Excellent bowling and excellent fielding to boot from Sri Lanka

Dismissal_text: Mahmudullah c Chameera b Lakmal 7 (20b 1x4 0x6) SR: 35.00

Commentary: drifts down leg, was there some glove on that? Yes, there was. It's a drop, it's poor from Dickwella. Strays on the leg stump, Rahim gets a bit of glove on his flick, the ball flies to his left, but Dickwella gets a bit of glove on that, and then it races away to fine leg.

Commentary: a tad short and Sabbir picks the length so quickly, short around off, he stays back and lays into a pull, smashed through midwicket for four.

Commentary: another poor delivery, drifts down leg, worked away to deep square leg

Commentary: on the pads again, swept nicely but straight to fine leg
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

Commentary: a big appeal, no says the umpire. Flat, spinning down leg, Rahim misses a flick. Dickwella collects and appeals. Mushfiqur is not happy that wasn't called a wide.
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

Commentary: but he strikes ... Mushfiqur has something to say to Sabbir. That was an awful stroke at 57 for 4. A full delivery on middle and leg, the ball moves back in slightly, Sabbir runs down at the bowler and looks to smash him over mid-on but that inward movement takes it off the inside half and lobs to mid-on. What a chance for Sabbir, he has thrown it away.
Commentary_short: Perera to Sabbir Rahman, OUT
Dismissal_text: Sabbir Rahman c sub (DSK Madushanka) b Perera 10 (12b 2x4 0x6) SR: 83.33

Commentary: short and wide outside off, 125 kph, left alone. Why are Sri Lanka targetting new batsmen with short balls? Surely, the better option is to go full and open more options. And go short if it doesn't work?
Commentary_short: Perera to Abul Hasan, no run

Commentary: full delivery around off, a thick inside edge towards square leg for a single

Commentary: good length delivery around middle and leg, defended solidly.

Commentary: back of a length delivery, at 125 kph, another solid defensive block from Rahim

Commentary: 132 kph, full and wide, Mushfiqur drives and hits the ball nicely to the deep point fielder

Commentary: lots of flight around off, clipped to midwicket. All about rebuilding now
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

Commentary: flat down leg, swept away to short fine leg, who runs to his left and parries the ball away towards square leg
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Mushfiqur Rahim, 2 runs

Commentary: two more, leg byes. Flat delivery outside off, the ball spins back in. Rahim, it seems, has got outside the line, but the ball rolls away towards fine leg for a couple of leg byes. Chandimal wants to review though. Doesn't look like there is bat, it spun back and hit him on the front leg in front of off. Was there too much turn? Actually, UltraEdge has a spike as it's passing the inside edge, so leg byes may have to be changed to runs.
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Mushfiqur Rahim, 2 runs

Commentary: flat and wide, spinning in, chopped away towards deep point for a run
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

Commentary: lovely hit through cover, 72 kph, lots of flight outside off from Sandakan, drilled through cover for a couple. Not a great over this this
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Abul Hasan, 2 runs

Commentary: a googly, off the pad, down to fine leg for a leg bye.
Commentary_short: Sandakan to Abul Hasan, 1 leg bye

Commentary: wow, that's a well-directed bouncer, on middle. Climbs steeply on the batsman who plays it down somehow. Very awkward fend
Commentary_short: Perera to Abul Hasan, no run

Commentary: 127 kph, short and wide again, Abul goes after it, and gets a toe-end on the shot, races away past slip for four.
Commentary_short: Perera to Abul Hasan, FOUR runs

Commentary: 128 kph and taken! So Sri Lanka continue to strike, but Abul Hasan reviews after speaking to Mushfiqur. He should have known. It's a full delivery outside off, the ball comes back in, takes the inside edge and carries through to Dickwella, who dives away to his right. That's an appalling review, you only get one in ODIs, and Mushfiqur or any other batsman can't review now if they get a shocker. A big spike on UltraEdge.
Commentary_short: Perera to Abul Hasan, OUT
Dismissal_text: Abul Hasan c †Dickwella b Perera 7 (7b 1x4 0x6) SR: 100.00
